option.od: print the help message and exit.
print the RST version number and exit.
use Kathrn McWilliams' 8-pulse sequence (default).
use Ray Greenwald's 13-pulse sequence.
use Mrinal Balaji / Jef Spaleta's 16-pulse sequence.
use the old 7-pulse sequence.
set the radar frequency to f MHz (default is 12 MHz).
set the background Doppler velocity to v m/s (default is 450 m/s).
set the Gaussian Doppler velocity spread (standard deviation) to v_s m/s (default is 0 m/s).
set the irregularity decay time to t_d milliseconds (default is 40 ms).
set the irregularity growth time to t_d microseconds (default is 1 us, ie negligible).
set the precipitation time constant (lifetime) to t_c milliseconds (default is 1e6 ms, ie negligible).
use a constant irregularity lifetime distribution (default is exponential).
add white noise level to produce SNR n dB (default is no noise).
set the sample separation to smsep microseconds (default is 300 us).
set the number of range gates to nrang (default is 100).

set the number of range gates with scatter to n_good (default is 40). WARNING: setting this above ~70 for katscan (or default) sequence will cause cross-range interference at lag0 from range gates ~70 and above (lag0 ~2x the value at other range gates).
set the first range gate containing scatter to srng (default is 0).
set the number of averages in the integration period to nave (default is 70/50/20 for oldscan/katscan/tauscan).
set the average ACF amplitude to amp (default is 1).

Remove cross-range interference from the ACFs (default is CRI on). WARNING: removing cross-range interference will make the raw samples unusable, since each range gate will have to be integrated separately.
Set the ACFs to have a decaying amplitude by a factor of 1/(r^2).
set the station identifier in the data records to stid (default is 0).
set the radar beam number in the data records to beam (default is 7).
set the multi-pulse increment of the pulse sequence to mpinc microseconds (default is 1500 us for katscan or 2400 us for oldscan/tauscan).
Output raw samples (in iqdat format) instead of ACFs (in rawacf format).

description.p: Generates simulated single-component Lorentzian ACFs in either rawacf (default) or iqdat format, which is then written to standard output.

example.description: Generates simulated single-component Lorentzian ACFs in rawacf format.
